pageContext.claim: “You know, we have a DC mayor that set up a commission, right, to talk about all of the things, cancel culture, let's talk about. They don't like the Washington Monument. They want it renamed or taken down. This was their recommenda -- don't worry about it, we're not doing it. I promise you. They don't like the Thomas Jefferson Memorial, because they don't like it. They -- they don't even know why. Tell me why. And they don't like, even the Lincoln Memorial, right? They don't like the Lincoln. So they wanted, uh, recommendations to change a name or take 'em down, and I said, 'I think this Commission should be immediately disbanded because it's not going' anywhere.' But they are -- uh, I mean these are -- this is a fact. Take down the Washington Monument? These people are stone-cold crazy.”
pageContext.analysis: District of Columbia Mayor Muriel Bowser created a working group to evaluate “public spaces to ensure the namesake's legacy is consistent with #DCValues” in the wake of the protests for racial justice this summer. The recommendations did initially name the Washington Monument and the Jefferson Memorial among the properties the commission recommended that the federal government “remove, relocate or contextualize.” The Lincoln Memorial was not mentioned in the report and the recommendations about all federal monuments have since been removed.
